intro: Adicea venulosa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that are typically tubular in shape. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in sandy soils. Adicea venulosa is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique floral display.
